title: Drawing, "Ovoidal frame"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Left row: above: the frame has a pediment on top which partly has been torn away. Below: on top is an eagle displayed, partly drawn over a crouching lion. A head is in the frame. Right row: one left side is shown with on top two griffons holding a blossom. Partly drawn over it are an upper part of the frame with two lions crouching beside the blossom, and a frame with two dragons holding the blossom. Above is a part of a frame with a broken pediment. Colored background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ovoidal frame".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1894.
